title: Design, "Screen Design:  "Temple of Nuclear Waste"", ca. 1985
medium: Black and gold marking pen, brush and watercolor (?), white crayon (?) on heavy, white tracing paper
inscribed: Inscribed in black marking pen lower center, right:  "Temple of Nuclear Waste;" lower center, left:  7. [encircled]
description: A three panel screen, viewed from reverse side, in form of three abstract black buildings with pediments and bases in gold and black.  Central structure has skyscraper-like pediment with two antenae; left structure has fan-shaped pediment; and right structure has dome, with antenae on either side.  Bases of three buildings have same triangular decoration.  In center right margin, smaller image of front side of screen with buildings in bright colors.

tombstone.epitaph:
Design, "Screen Design:  "Temple of Nuclear Waste"", ca. 1985.
ca. 1985. Black and gold marking pen, brush and watercolor (?), white crayon (?) on heavy, white tracing paper. Gift of Ken Friedman. 1997-19-120.
